channel.title: Comments on: Rolling deployments to AWS using Octopus Deploy and Auto Scaling Groups
channel.description: A blog about things I learn at the keyboard: DevOps, CI/CD, Cloud, Automation, to name a few....

item.title: By: Marcus
item.dc:creator: Marcus
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://marcusfelling.com/blog/blog/2017/rolling-deployments-aws-using-octopus-deploy-auto-scaling-groups/#comment-3138">Kelly</a>.
Hey Kelly, my experience with Octopus Deploy was with an EC2 hosted instance. I have not used Octopus Deploy Cloud yet. It was just <a href="https://octopus.com/blog/announcing-octopus-cloud" rel="nofollow">announced in July</a>.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Kelly.

Hey Kelly, my experience with Octopus Deploy was with an EC2 hosted instance. I have not used Octopus Deploy Cloud yet. It was just announced in July.

item.title: By: Kelly
item.dc:creator: Kelly
item.description: Are you running Octopus Deploy in the cloud?
item.content:encoded: Are you running Octopus Deploy in the cloud?

item.title: By: Julio Wilcoxon
item.dc:creator: Julio Wilcoxon
item.description: Thank you so much for the great article, it was fluent and to the point. Cheers.
item.content:encoded: Thank you so much for the great article, it was fluent and to the point. Cheers.
